intro: Tagetes riojana, commonly known as the Mexican marigold, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow or orange flowers with a strong, aromatic scent. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are often used in traditional medicine and as a natural insect repellent. Tagetes riojana is also popular in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
